value.0: Greetings to you, <lad/lass>, and welcome to the Ravenclaw Tavern! I am Ruknar, proud Tavern Keeper of this fine establishment!
So, <lad/lass>, what can I do for you today?
As you wish, <lad/lass>... Feel free to return anytime...
Well of course, <lad/lass>! We're always open for business here at the Ravenclaw Tavern!
Eh, I bet I know the one... We had a young Elven woman rent out a room here for the week, and as far as I know, she's still with us...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartAction>[The Dwarf looks at you suspiciously.]</Start> Well, we don't usually go around giving out room keys, you know...
As you wish, <lad/lass>.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> <StartAction>[The Dwarf glowers angrily at you.]</Start> I'm going to have to ask you to leave now, <lad/lass>. I don't take kindly to thieves around here...
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> <StartAction>[You manage to swipe a key from the desk without the innkeeper noticing... You quickly pocket it and bid him farewell.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> I suppose you do seem like a nice enough sort... Alright, then, I guess I can give you the key, but don't make me regret it!
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> I suppose you do seem like a nice enough sort... Alright, then, I guess I can give you the key, but don't make me regret it!
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> I suppose you do seem like a nice enough sort... Alright, then, I guess I can give you the key, but don't make me regret it!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, <lad/lass>, but I can't just go around giving out room keys, you know...
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> I suppose you do seem like a nice enough sort... Alright, then, I guess I can give you the key, but don't make me regret it!
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> Well, I don't see any reason why not... After all, you seem a nice enough sort...
<StartAction>[The Dwarf pulls forth a key from the desk in front of him.]</Start> There you go. It's Room # 1, the one on the right at the end of the hallway. Hope you find what you're looking for...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_KARA" >>

Aye, I saw that unfortunate affair. Those men were agents of Pharos Nightcrawler, if rumor is to be trusted. He's a dangerous crime lord in the city of Laceri. I wouldn't hold out much hope for your friend if they got their hands on 'im...

I'd suggest doing so, <lad/lass>. Those men aren't the type to be trifled with. If that Halfling got tangled up with them, let him deal with the consequences. Better to keep your own hide safe, if you ask me...

Well, they never did pay their bar tap, so I don't suppose I owe those particular patrons any loyalty. I've heard they've been seen around the boathouse in the Market District. It might be worth taking a gander there...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_TARI" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
Nothing right now...
What do you have to offer here?
I'm looking for a pretty Elven woman.
I see... Thank you for your help.
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Can I get her room key from you?
I suppose I can understand that... Just forget what I said.
<StartAction>[Pick Pocket]</Start> <StartAction>[Attempt to take the key from Ruknar.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> I'm sure you'd reconsider for 50 gold...
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Would 20 gold pieces change your mind?
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Would 10 gold pieces convince you ?
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> I only wish to speak with her...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_KARA" >>
A Halfling was kidnapped here. See anything?
Good point. Perhaps I should steer clear.
Do you know where I might look?
Thanks.
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_TARI" >>
